Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk compat-opensm-libs
exit 0

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk perftest
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: RDMA stack bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux includes a collection of Infiniband and iWARP utilities, libraries and development packages for writing applications that use Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) technology. Several RDMA packages have been upgraded to latest upstream versions, which provide a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions: The libmlx4 packages have been upgraded to version 1.0.6. Among other changes, the wire protocol for RDMA Over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) headers has been updated so that the RoCE headers are now based on IP addressing and not on a combination of a MAC address and a VLAN tag. (BZ#1051217) The perftest packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.3. This version primarily improves support for alternate architectures, such as 64-bit PowerPC, Red Hat Enterprise Linux for POWER, little endian, and 64-bit ARM. (BZ#1061582) The infiniband-diags packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.6.4. This new version improves large fabric diagnostics. (BZ#1061586) The opensm packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.3.18. The main changes include improvements in various routing engines, and updates to the Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV) support and GID handling. (BZ#1061587) The infinipath-psm packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.3-rc. This new version among others improves multi-CPU message rate scaling. (BZ#1085255) The mstflint packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.7.1. This new version improves support for the latest generation of Mellanox's cards. (BZ#1107624) The libcxgb4 packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.3.5. Among other changes, support for later version of firmware and adapters has been provided. (BZ#1160417) Bug fixes: Several RDMA utilities only worked on devices that supported the IBV_INLINE data sends. As a consequence, these utilities did not run on Intel GiB-based hardware. With this update, the utilities have been modified to detect whether or not the IBV_INLINE sends are supported by the hardware. As a result, the utilities do not attempt to use the IBV_INLINE sends if the hardware does not support them. (BZ#1059133) In the upstream version of the libipathverbs packages, support for configuring certain parameters of GiB adapters using the kernel module options was removed. Consequently, on specific mezzanine boards that required configuration of mezzanine specific parameters, the card was not recognized. A script has been added to configure these cards without the kernel module options. As a result, these cards now work as expected. Note that the initramfs images of the cards must be rebuilt after installing the updated libipathverbs packages. (BZ#1085946) Due to a typographical error in the underlying code, it was impossible to remove flow rules in the libmlx4 flow steering system. This update corrects this error and libmlx4 flow steering support now works as expected. (BZ1094988) Enhancements: Support for RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) communications on Emulex hardware is provided with this update. (BZ#1118697) Also, this enhancement update adds the libusnic_verbs packages to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 as a Technology Preview. Cisco UCM servers have an optional feature to provide a Cisco proprietary User Space Network Interface Controller (usNIC), which allows RDMA-like operations for user space applications. The libusnic_verbs packages provides a driver for utilizing these usNIC devices using standard IB Verbs-based RDMA programming. (BZ#916384) More information about Red Hat Technology Previews is available here: https://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/techpreview/ Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
